alert.note: Alert for Alpine (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 12:43PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Reno has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in California...Nevada... West Fork Carson River At Woodfords affecting Douglas and Alpine Counties. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and increase river flows. For the West Fork Carson River...including Woodfords...The river is expected to reach Minor Flood stage briefly each night before dipping back into Action Stage prior to sunrise. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. The highest flows will occur late evening into the overnight hours each day. * WHERE...West Fork Carson River At Woodfords. * WHEN...From Sunday evening until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.5 feet, Minor flooding begins in lowest areas along the West Fork of the Carson River in southwest Carson Valley including agricultural areas, local roads and outbuildings. Residents along the river should prepare for more serious flooding if there are additional rises expected due to snowmelt and/or rainfall runoff. Impacts will be more significant if heavy rain and/or snowmelt causing significant rises in small creeks draining the east side of the Carson Range below Woodfords. Similar to peak of Feb 2017 event. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:05 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 12.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 13.7 feet early Thursday morning. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 13.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Sun Mon Tue Wed West Fork Carson River Woodfords 13.5 12.8 13.4 13.6 13.5 13.6 &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Water will be swift moving and very cold. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon by 2 PM PDT.
